Description: Limestone ostracon: with a seated figure of the god Amun on the recto, painted in black with red guide-lines. He is shown holding 'was'-sceptre and seated on a throne. In front of the figure are two vertical lines of hieroglyphic inscription. The recto bears a painted figure a a king, also in black with red guides The figure is in side view with raised arms; wears a kilt and the Blue crown.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Biban el-Muluk (Valley of the Kings - Thebes)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: C.N. Reeves, ‘Göttinger Miszellen’ 88 (Göttingen, 1985), p.44, n.II.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393579) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393579)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006/8 Sept-Sept, Wallsend, Segedunum Roman Fort & Baths Museum, Egypt Revealed 2009 May-present, Newcastle, Great North Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir John Gardner Wilkinson
